did.unittitle: Xavier University Department of Mathematics and Computer Science records
did.abstract: This is a small collection of documents originating with the Xavier University Department of Mathematics and Computer Science.

bioghist.head: History of Xavier University Department of Mathematics and Computer Science
bioghist.p: From 11/4/1946 to 3/31/1955 the department was known as the Department of Physics and Mathematics. In March, 1955 this department split into two different departments: the Department of Physics and the Department of Mathematics. The Department of Physics exists to this day. The Department of Mathematics became a new department in 1988: the Department of Mathematics and Computer Science.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This small collection consists mainly of two self-studies: a self-study of the computer science program and a self-study of the mathematics program.

arrangement.head: Statement of Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials are arranged into folders in chronological order.

scopecontent.p: This folder contains the publication "Self-Study of the Mathematics Program, for the period September, 1989-December, 1995." The publication includes a history of mathematics departments at Xavier beginning in 1915. Also of interest (in Appendix C-1) is "The Pi Mu Epsilon Address of Raymond Allen, S.J." which gives historical insights on Xavier mathematics departments.

did.unittitle: Self-study of the Computer Science Program

scopecontent.p: This folder contains the publication "Self-study of the Computer Science Program, for the Period September, 1989 to December, 1996," and also the update for this publication for the period December, 1996-August, 1999. Consult the update volume for a history of the Computer Science program at Xavier from 1964 to 1997.
